content.title: Education Assistance/Ph.D Scheme (GBOCWWB)
content.department: Labour, Skill Development & Employment Department, Government of Gujarat
content.details: The “Education Assistance/Ph.D Scheme” is implemented by the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Worker’s Welfare Board (GBOCWWB). Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided once a year to any two children of a construction worker for the career development of bright and needy construction worker students seeking admission in higher education courses.
benefits: Financial assistance for students from Standard 1 to 12, as well as for those pursuing Graduation and Postgraduate studies.
Hostel assistance of ₹1,200/- per month for 10 months for children studying outside their taluk.
Book assistance for first-year admitted students ranging from ₹3,000/- to ₹10,000/- depending on the course.
eligibility: Children of construction workers registered with the Gujarat Building and other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The child must be enrolled in any grade from Class I up to higher education or professional course.
Financial assistance is provided once a year to two children of a construction worker.
exclusions: Assistance is not provided if the child is admitted through Right to Education or studying in an Open University.
Assistance is limited to the first attempt in each academic year.
content.application_process: Online and Offline applications are accepted. Applicants must register on the e-Nirman Portal and follow the steps to submit their application.
documents_required: Proof of age (Birth certificate/Driving Licence/PAN Card/Voter ID Card)
Original Bonafide Certificate of the Beneficiary's ongoing course
Passport-size photographs of beneficiary and child
Copy of the child's previous year's result
Certificate from the registered hostel/school/college/institute if applicable
Original bill of purchase of books for book aid
Gazette/Affidavit from Beneficiary if Surname and Name are different
Affidavit or letter of consent for assistance of ₹5000/- or more

faqs.question: What are the benefits provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Benefits include financial assistance for various education levels, hostel assistance, and book assistance.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Children of construction workers registered with the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board are eligible.

faqs.question: Is there any restriction on the educational level for eligibility?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme covers children enrolled in any grade from Class I up to higher education.

faqs.question: How often is financial assistance provided?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance is provided once a year to two children of a construction worker.

faqs.question: Is there an age limit for eligibility?
faqs.answer: The age limit is a maximum of 30 years, but there is no limit for handicapped children.

faqs.question: What is the criteria for hostel assistance?
faqs.answer: Hostel assistance is provided to children studying outside their taluk and not in government/subsidized hostels.
